adjectives.description: pervertible (comparative more pervertible, superlative most pervertible)

entries.meaning: A person who is liable to corruption.
examples: At the time it could scarcely be called a town but in years to come Sloane, Arkansas would be a mecca for gamblers and pervertibles, a veritable caldron of sin and perdition.

entries.meaning: An everyday or household object that can be used in sexual activity.
examples: Don't be surprised if your geek lover puts more thought into arranging the boudoir than you do, or if common household items ("pervertibles") soon take on a new dimension.
